heading.content: Introduction: What are we going to learn this lesson?

items.content: In this webquest you will learn more about volcanoes. Follow the steps.

heading.content: Task: What are you going to look for?

items.content: You are going to look for how a volcano is formed.

heading.content: Work process: How does it work?
Step 1. Go to the link and watch the video and answer the questions

values.value: a mountain or hill, typically conical, having a crater or vent through which lava, rock fragments, hot vapour, and gas are or have been erupted from the earth's crust.

content.body: a mountain or hill, typically conical, having a crater or vent through which lava, rock fragments, hot vapour, and gas are or have been erupted from the earth's crust.

values.value: You can find volcanoes in the Ring of Fire.

content.body: You can find volcanoes in the Ring of Fire.

heading.content: Step 2. Click on the link. Watch from 4:37 to 6:00. Answer the question after the video.

prompt.body: Where do the elements belong? Magma chamber, vent, lava, ash and gas.

heading.content: Step 3: Go check the video and website

items.description: Go to the website and check it out.

prompt.body: What is it called when two tectonic plates move towards each other?
What is it called when two tectonic plates move away from each other?
What comes out when a volcano erupts?
What are the two types of boundaries that can cause a volcano to form?

values.value: divergent plate boundaries and convergent plate boundaries

content.body: divergent plate boundaries and convergent plate boundaries

items.content: Now you know how a volcano is formed.
Make your own volcano. Go to the link https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8AqoOOJ3H_I.
